questions.text: E-FAST in trauma is not good to detect?

A 20 year old man met with an cycle accident when handle of cycle hit his lower abdomen. He was brought to hospital next day with pain lower abdomen. He has not passed urine since he sustained trauma. On examination no bladder lump could be palpated and there is diffuse tenderness in lower abdomen. Ultrasound revealed a partially full bladder with free fluid in abdomen. Cystogram picture is given below. What is the ideal treatment for this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Pass a foleys catheter and leave the catheter for2 weeks

options.label: B
options.text: Immediate surgery and repair of Intraperitoneal bladder rupture with absorbable suture

options.label: C
options.text: Immediate surgery and repair of extraperitoneal bladder rupture with absorbable suture

options.label: D
options.text: Immediate surgery and repair of extraperitoneal bladder rupture with non- absorbable suture

questions.correct_answer: B. Immediate surgery and repair of Intraperitoneal bladder rupture with absorbable suture

questions.text: A 14 years old boy is presented with absent both testis in scrotum. On examination, left testis was Found in superior ingDuinal pouch and right testis in inguinal canal. What is the diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Right Ectopic testis and left undescended testis.

options.label: C
options.text: Left Ectopic testis and right undescended testis.

questions.correct_answer: C. Left Ectopic testis and right undescended testis.

questions.text: A patient presented in the OPD with hematuria. He has been suffering from recurrent episodes of urinary tract infection. Identify the pathology in the image given below:
Which of the following is true about the condition shown in the picture of a patient who underwent catheterization?

options.label: A
options.text: Sickle cell disease increases the risk of this condition

options.label: B
options.text: Usually caused by doctor forgetting to reduce the foreskin after catheterization

options.label: C
options.text: Previous circumcision protects against this condition

options.label: D
options.text: May lead to obstruction of lymphatic and venous return from the glans

questions.correct_answer: A. Sickle cell disease increases the risk of this condition

questions.text: A patient presented with increased frequency of micturition. On cystoscopy, Pale ureteric orifice was seen. Cystogram image is given below. What is the most probable diagnosis?

On 2nd post op day after thyroidectomy for Graves disease a patient was found Pyrexic, and tachypnoeic. Her PR was 120/min and BP was 160/110 mmHg, there was obvious irritability and slurring of speech. Which of the following drug will be least effective in this condition?
Thyroid scan shows, single hot nodule in right lobe. What do you expect to find in this patient?

Gibson incision is made for?
Main advantage of Connell’s sutures in bowel anastomosis is?

options.label: A
options.text: Used when there is discrepancy in lumen of bowel

options.label: B
options.text: Helps in inverting the edges of intestine

options.label: C
options.text: Helps in making the anastomosis watertight

options.label: D
options.text: Used with bevelled edges to make lumen bigger

questions.correct_answer: B. Helps in inverting the edges of intestine

questions.text: Fase statement about bed sore is?

options.label: C
options.text: All 4 gland Parathyroidectomy and autoimplantation in bracheoradialis muscle.

questions.correct_answer: C. All 4 gland Parathyroidectomy and autoimplantation in bracheoradialis muscle.

questions.text: False statement regarding Bochdalek hernia is?

options.label: B
options.text: It is the commonest type of congenital diaphragmatic hernia.

options.label: C
options.text: More common on the left side.

options.label: D
options.text: More common on the anterior part (retrosternal).

questions.correct_answer: D. More common on the anterior part (retrosternal).

questions.text: True statement about Gas Gangrene is?

options.label: A
options.text: Most common causative organism is Clostridium septicum.

options.label: B
options.text: Commonest cause of non traumatic gas gangrene is C. Perfringens.

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: C. CPK, Myoglobin, and K level may be high.

questions.text: Steriotactic core needle biopsy of mammographic calcification demonstrates sclerosing adenosis associated with the calcification and LCIS not associated with calcifications (an incidental finding). The patient should be treated by?

options.label: B
options.text: Re-excisionto negative margin followed by whole breast irradiation.

options.label: C
options.text: Re-excision to negative margin, sentinel node biopsy and whole breast irradiation.

options.label: D
options.text: Close surveillance including annual mammography and biannual clinical breast examination.

questions.correct_answer: D. Close surveillance including annual mammography and biannual clinical breast examination.

questions.text: Prophylactic antibiotics are indicated in?

options.label: A
options.text: Before Foleys catheter placement to avoid urinary tract infection.

options.label: B
options.text: In ventilated patient to avoid pneumonia.

options.label: C
options.text: Before the placement of central line.

options.label: D
options.text: To decrease the rate of surgical site infection after indicated operation.

questions.correct_answer: D. To decrease the rate of surgical site infection after indicated operation.

questions.text: A patient was planned for bariatric procedure due to inability to achieve weight loss with medical therapy and having a class III obesity with DM II, HT and GERD. Which procedure should be avoided in this patient?

A 27 years old primigravida has 38 weeks of pregnancy. She has the fetus in cephalic presentation. Her fundal height is 31 cm without correction of the dextrorotation and it is 32 cm after correction of the dextrorotation. On PV examination, the station of the fetus is -1. Head of the fetus is 3/5th palpable. How much is the approximate fetal weight?

A 23 years old primigravida has come to the antenatal OPD. She has pregnancy of 5 months. This is her 2nd ANC visit. She is certain about her last menstrual period. Which of the following is the best method of calculating the gestational age of this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Crown Rump length of first trimester USG

options.label: C
options.text: Crown Rump length of 5th month USG.

questions.correct_answer: B. Crown Rump length of first trimester USG

questions.text: A 38 years old multiparous patient has undergone a quadruple marker test at 18th week. Her AFP is raised and it is 3 times MoM. Which of the following is not the likely cause?

A 32 years old nulliparous patient has an unruptured ectopic pregnancy in the isthmus of the fallopian tube. Her B-HCG level is 12090 IU/L. Her pulse is 83 per minute and BP is 104/78mm of Hg. There is no free fluid in the pouch of Douglas. Which of the following is the best way of treatment in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Inj. Methotrexate therapy by single dose regimen

options.label: B
options.text: Inj. Methotrexate therapy by multiple doses regimen

questions.text: A 32 years old primigravida has 19 weeks of gestation with history of bleeding per vaginum since last 2 hours. There is a history of trauma by road-traffic-accident. Her vital signs are normal but there is a retroplacental blood collection in the fundus of uterus and it is of 2 cm in size. Her cervix is not dilated. Fetal heart sounds are audible and 140 beats per minute. What is your diagnosis?

questions.text: Which one of the following is correct about the given test?

options.label: A
options.text: It is done in Rh negative pregnancy with ICT positive state

options.label: B

Which of the following mycotic infection of the small intestine affects immunocompetent as well as immunocompromised persons?

questions.text: The syndrome of inappropriate ADH secretion (SIADH) is characterized by the following;

questions.text: A 12 year-old patient of came with complaints of fever for 3 days. You have a clinical suspicion of dengue and you have to investigate on him. Which of the following test will not be helpful at this point of time?

options.text: Viral culture with C6/C3 cell cultures

questions.text: A 6 year old child is brought with a 2-week day history of not feeding well and excessive irritability. Neck rigidity is present. History of TB in sister in present. Which of the following is likely to be found in CSF analysis?

options.label: A
options.text: Lymphocytosis, low sugar and high protein

options.label: B
options.text: Lymphocytosis, high sugar and high protein

options.label: C
options.text: Neutrophils, low sugar and low protein

options.label: D
options.text: Neutrophils, low sugar and high protein

questions.correct_answer: A. Lymphocytosis, low sugar and high protein

questions.text: A 65-year-old man is brought to hospital with complaints of suddenly not making any sense while speaking using non sensical grammar though he can speak quickly. He could communicate effectively prior to this. Which of the following defect is present in this patient?

Recently for work up of haemoptysis multiple cavitary lesions were noted in both lungs. Which of the following tests would help in confirming diagnosis of this condition?

A 40 kg female patient admitted in hospital for past one week is currently having multiple episodes of seizures. On work up Serum sodium of 110 meq/L. Calculate the maximum sodium (in mmol/L) to be given in initial 24 hours to this patient?

A 45-year-old male presented with weight loss, polyuria, polydipsia and polyphagia for the last 3 months. His fasting plasma glucose is 106 mg/dL and random blood glucose is 220 mg/dL. Which one of the following statements is correct regarding his diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: He has impaired glucose tolerance UGT).

options.label: B
options.text: He has definitive diagnosis of diabetes mellitus.

options.label: C
options.text: He does not have diabetes mellitus.

options.label: D
options.text: Diagnosis of diabetes mellitus is indeterminate as HbA1c value is not provided,

questions.correct_answer: B. He has definitive diagnosis of diabetes mellitus.

questions.text: Which one of the following statements is true regarding the use of SGLT2 inhibitor in management of diabetes mellitus?

options.label: A
options.text: They are used in both type-1, type-2 diabetes mellitus.

options.label: B
options.text: They cause increase in blood pressure by 3—6 mm Hg and hence avoided in hypertensive patients.

options.label: C
options.text: Their glucose-lowering effect is dependent on insulin secretion and insulin sensitivity.

options.label: D
options.text: Euglycemic diabetic ketoacidosis may occur during treatment if there is a concurrent illness.

questions.correct_answer: D. Euglycemic diabetic ketoacidosis may occur during treatment if there is a concurrent illness.

questions.text: A 50-year lady, who is a known case of rheumatoid arthritis, presents with obesity moon facies, abdominal striae and hypertension. Overnight dexamethasone suppression test shows serum cortisol is greater than 50 nmol/ L, serum ACTH is low. The adrenal imaging and brain CT/MRI imaging studies are unremarkable. The likely diagnosis is
Which one of the following is a cause of relative erythrocytosis?
Which of the following statements are correct regarding inflammatory bowel disease:

options.label: A
options.text: Ulcerative colitis (UC) involves terminal ileum and rarely causes proctitis.

options.label: B
options.text: Cobblestone appearance of bowel is seen in Crohn's disease.

options.label: C
options.text: Skip lesions are a characteristic of ulcerative colitis but never seen in Crohn's disease.

options.label: D
options.text: Ulcerative colitis is more common in smokers than non-smokers.

questions.correct_answer: B. Cobblestone appearance of bowel is seen in Crohn's disease.

options.label: A
options.text: Detailed data is collected as compared to hospital-based cancer registry.

options.label: B
options.text: All the people residing in an area with cancer for a period more than 6 months.

options.label: C
options.text: Important to indicate about geographical relationship of cancers.

options.label: D
options.text: Collected by Health workers by visiting the home of people.

questions.correct_answer: A. Detailed data is collected as compared to hospital-based cancer registry.

questions.text: In the formulae for “SD” if n < 30; then the denominator is:

options.label: A

options.text: All hospital care at tertiary hospital is free.

options.label: C
options.text: All hospital care at primary hospital is free.

questions.correct_answer: B. All hospital care at tertiary hospital is free.

Incubation period is 4 - 7 days. 4. One of the prominent symptoms is arthropathy. Select the correct answer using the code given below:

Consider the following statements: Statement-I: While calculating the number of expected pregnancies per year in an area, a correction factor (usually 10%) is added to the expected number of live births in the year in the area. Statement-II: All the pregnancies in the area may not be registered by the health worker in the area. Which one of the following is correct in respect of the above statements?

options.label: A
options.text: Statement-I and Statement-II are independently correct, and Statement-II is a correct explanation for Statement-I.

options.label: B
options.text: Statement-I and Statement-II are independently correct, but Statement-II is not a correct explanation for Statement-I.

options.label: C
options.text: Statement-I is correct, but Statement-II is incorrect.

options.label: D
options.text: Statement-I is incorrect, but Statement-II is correct.

questions.correct_answer: B. Statement-I and Statement-II are independently correct, but Statement-II is not a correct explanation for Statement-I.

questions.text: A one-month old baby is brought with complaints of watering and discharge from eyes. Cornea was normal and there was a regurge material on pressing the area between eye and nose. The most likely diagnosis is:

A microbiologist is studying the structure and function of bacterial cell walls. In an experiment, group A streptococci are treated with chemicals to solubilize the cell wall. Various cell wall associated proteins are subsequently extracted. Electron microscopic evaluation of a specific protein shows structural homology with mammalian tropomyosin and myosin. This protein acts as a virulence factor for certain species of the organism. Which of the following is the most likely function of this bacterial cell wall-associated protein?

Researchers investigating infections in immunocompromised individuals enroll patients with solid-organ malignancy who have received conventional cytotoxic chemotherapy. Detailed microbiologic data are obtained on any patient who develops fever during periods of chemotherapy-induced neutropenia. Which of the following pathogens are most likely to be identified as the cause of these patients' infections?

A 10-month-old boy is brought to the emergency department due to 2 days of fever, irritability and vomiting. The patient has had no prior significant medical conditions and has received all recommended vaccinations, including protein-conjugated, 13-valent pneumococcal capsular polysaccharide vaccines (PCV13) at ages 2, 4, and 6 months. On physical examination, the patient is febrile and lethargic, with a bulging anterior fontanelle. Lumbar puncture yields turbid fluid with an abundance of neutrophils. Gram stain of cerebrospinal fluid reveals the pathogen as shown in the image. Which of the following best explains this patient's current condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Antigenic variation of bacterial cell wall

questions.text: A previously healthy 23-year-old man comes to the office due to abrupt-onset high fever, chills headache, and weakness that developed after he spent a month working on a large ranch. His initial symptoms were quickly followed by intensely painful swellings in the groin. Physical examination is significant for tender and enlarged inguinal lymph nodes with overlying erythematous skin. Blood cultures and fluid aspirated from the lymph nodes grow gram negative coccobacilli that resemble a closed safety pin on special staining. Which of the following activities is the most likely source of this patient's infection?

A 3-year-old girl is brought to the emergency department with abrupt-onset vomiting followed by frequent, large-volume, watery diarrhea for the last day. She has no prior medical conditions but has not received recommended vaccinations. Temperature is 37.8 C. Physical examination shows mild dehydration. The abdomen is soft and mildly tender to palpation throughout. Bowel sounds are increased. Polymerase chain reaction testing of the stool sample yields a virus with a segmented, double-stranded RNA genome. Which of the following pathologic findings is most likely to be present in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Blunting of the villi in the duodenum and proximal jejunum

options.label: B
options.text: Extensive colonic mucosal injury with yellow-white adherent layer

options.label: C
options.text: Flask-shaped ulcerations in the cecum and ascending colon

options.label: D
options.text: Foamy macrophages in the small intestinal lamina propria

questions.correct_answer: A. Blunting of the villi in the duodenum and proximal jejunum

questions.text: A 23-year-old pregnant woman is found to have chronic viral hepatitis B on liver biopsy. The presence of which of the following serologic markers is most likely to increase the risk of vertical transmission of the virus?

A 3-year-old boy experiences recurrent sinusitis and an episode of severe pneumonia. As part of his evaluation, Candida extract is injected intradermally. Forty-eight hours later, he returns to the clinic with a firm nodule measuring 16 mm in diameter where the extract was injected. Which of the following cell types is most likely responsible for the reaction observed in this patient?

While working as part of a medical relief team in Afghanistan, a medical student observes a 35-year-old man with a lesion seen on his hand. A skin scraping is taken from the lesion and stained with Giemsa shown in the image. Choose the correct vector for this condition..

A 20-year-old woman returns from a 1-month vacation is suffering from crampy abdominal pain and diarrhea. She spent most of her vacation in rural areas and took no precautions with the food or water she consumed. Her physician is concerned about a parasitic infection, so stool specimens are collected for O& P examination: an organism is found in her stool specimens shown in the image. Which organism is responsible for her infection?

A 26-year-old man with AIDS develops interstitial pneumonitis. His CD4 T cell count is below 200/Cumm and his serum levels of lactamase dehydrogenase are markedly elevated, A chest radiograph shows infiltrates that have a diffuse, fluffy appearance and that spread outward from the hilar areas. Which test would have the greatest accuracy in diagnosing this infection?

options.label: B
options.text: Hearing loss should be seen on minimum 3 frequencies

options.label: C
options.text: Hearing loss should have occurred within 3 days

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: D. Bilateral Hearing loss should be there

questions.text: All of the following are concerned with auditory pathways except:

Mr. X was treated with haloperidol, a typical antipsychotic drug. It is known that antipsychotic drugs can block central and peripheral receptors with different affinity. This can explain several adverse effects of these drugs. Which of the following sets of adverse effects (from A to D) is most likely to be correct for haloperidol? Abbreviations: EPS, extrapyramidal symptoms; SE, sedation; Hypo, hypotension; A-ch, anticholinergic effects.

A 54-year-old African American male presents to the emergency department with 1 day history of severe headaches. He has a history of poorly controlled hypertension and notes he hasn't been taking his antihypertensive medications. His temperature is 100.1 deg F (37.8 deg C), blood pressure is 190/90 mmHg, pulse is 60/min, and respirations are 15/min. He is started on a high concentration sodium nitroprusside infusion and transferred to the intensive care unit. His blood pressure eventually improves over the next two days and his headache resolves, but he becomes confused and tachycardic. Labs reveal a metabolic acidosis. Which of the following is the best treatment?

Find out the false and true statements regarding beta blockers A. propranolol has highest membrane stabilizing property B. Tilisolol has potassium channel opening property C. Labetalol has norepinephrine reuptake inhibitory property D. Nebivolol has insulin sensitizing activity E. Acebutolol useful in smith magenis syndrome
questions.correct_answer: B. A-T, B-T, C.-T, D-T, F-T

On initial physical examination, a 4,500-g neonate is noted to have an umbilical hernia, macroglossia, unusual ear creases, hemihypertrophy, and visceromegaly. Soon after delivery, he develops persistent hypoglycemia warranting treatment with intravenous dextrose. Of the following, this neonate is at INCREASED risk for

A 2-year-old boy with trisomy 21 has persistent tachypnea. He has a history of oxygen desaturation with minor viral illnesses, with oxygen saturation as low as 80% on pulse oximetry. He sometimes snores at night, but does not have respiratory pauses or witnessed apneic events. On physical examination, his oxygen saturation in room air is 96%, respiratory rate is 45 breaths/min, and heart rate is 120 beats/min. His breath sounds are clear to auscultation, heart has normal rhythm with no murmur or gallop, and oropharynx shows 2+ tonsils in a small pharynx. Of the following, the MOST likely findings on echocardiography include a

options.label: A
options.text: Large ventricular septal defect with left-to-right flow

options.label: B
options.text: Left ventricular hypertrophy with mitral valve regurgitation

options.label: C
options.text: Normal size and motion of the interventricular septum

options.label: D
options.text: Right ventricular hypertrophy with tricuspid valve regurgitation

questions.correct_answer: D. Right ventricular hypertrophy with tricuspid valve regurgitation

questions.text: A 5-day-old female neonate is brought to the office in response to a call from the state laboratory reporting a thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) level higher than 200 mIU/L (normal <30 mIU/L) on her newborn screen. The neonate was born via uncomplicated spontaneous vaginal delivery at 40 weeks’ gestation with a birthweight of 3.5 kg. Her mother took levothyroxine for Hashimoto thyroiditis and prenatal vitamins during pregnancy. The neonate has been breastfeeding well on demand. Her vital signs are normal. She has mild jaundice and a small, reducible umbilical hernia. Her thyroid does not appear enlarged. The physical examination findings are otherwise normal. Confirmatory thyroid function tests show a TSH of 520 mIU/L (normal 0.6-5.6 mIU/L) and a free thyroxine of 0.5 ng/dL (6.4 pmol/L; normal 1.2-3.4 ng/dL [15.4-43.7 pmol/L]). Of the following, the MOST likely cause of this neonate’s laboratory findings is

A 7-year-old boy is seen for evaluation of swelling over his eyelids for 10 days. His mother reports that the swelling is more prominent upon waking and gradually improves throughout the day. The boy had an upper respiratory tract infection 2 weeks ago. He has a history of mild intermittent asthma. He has a heart rate of 82 beats/min, respiratory rate of 16 breaths/min, and blood pressure of 105/62 mm Hg. He has periorbital edema and pitting edema of ankles. His chest is clear to auscultation. The rest of the physical examination findings are unremarkable. Laboratory data from spot urinalysis with microscopy are shown: Laboratory Test URINE pH 6.5; Specific gravity 1.030; Leukocyte esterase Negative Nitrite Negative; Blood 1+ Protein 3+; Red blood cells 5-10/HPF; White blood cells < 5/HPF Of the following, the BEST next step in evaluation of this patient is

options.label: B
options.text: Renal function test, serum albumin, and complement levels

options.label: D
options.text: Repeat urinalysis 1 week after a trial of diphenhydramine

questions.correct_answer: B. Renal function test, serum albumin, and complement levels

questions.text: An 8-hour-old neonate who was delivered at 39 2/7 weeks’ gestational age is reported to be dusky in appearance and tachycardic. Neither the maternal history nor prenatal laboratory results are of concern. The neonate’s heart rate is 280 beats/min, respiratory rate is 80 breaths/min, and blood pressure is 40/20 mm Hg. The pulse oximeter will not give a reading on the right hand. Pulses are present throughout, but weak. Electrocardiography is performed Of the following, the BEST next step in management is

A 3-year-old boy underwent a laparoscopic splenectomy 6 months ago to control hemolysis associated with hereditary spherocytosis. Of the following, this child's medical history MOST increases his risk for

A previously healthy 9-month-old female infant is seen in the emergency department with a 2- day history of fever and decreased appetite. She has no history of vomiting, diarrhea, cough, or nasal congestion. Her temperature is 39.5°C. She is alert and interactive. She is mildly dehydrated, and there is no focus of infection. A catheterized urine sample is collected. Urinalysis results are shown: Leukocyte esterase 2+ Nitrite Negative White blood cells 20-50/HPF She fails an oral fluid challenge and is admitted to the hospital for intravenous antibiotics. Her urine culture grows 50,000 CFU/mL of Escherichia coli. Renal ultrasonography shows mild left hydronephrosis. Of the following, the MOST appropriate next step is to

A 2-year-old boy's parents are concerned about significant speech delay. He exhibits unusual dysmorphology, including malar and zygomatic hypoplasia with downslanting palpebral fissures; prominent nose; significant micrognathia and retrognathia; small, posteriorly rotated, and malformed ears; and lower eyelid colobomas with absent eyelashes. His father has similar dysmorphology. Of the following, the MOST likely reason for this boy's speech delay is

A 15-year-old girl is being evaluated as a new patient. She recently relocated to the United States from Mexico. Aside from a hole in her heart that was noted at birth, she reports being otherwise healthy. She has not had any operations, and is not taking any medications. She has no record of her prior immunizations. The girl describes recently feeling short of breath with nonstrenuous daily activities, needing to nap more frequently, and having fainted once while walking up the stairs at home. Although fatigued, she continues to perform well academically. On physical examination, her heart rate is regular at 100 beats/min, respiratory rate is 25 breaths/min, oxygen saturation is 80%, and blood pressure is 90/60 mm Hg. Her height and weight are at the 50th percentile for age. She has a dusky appearance; a normal S1, loud S2, and no murmur; her liver is palpable 4 cm below the costal margin; and her fingernails are clubbed. She has stage 3 pubic hair and breast development. The remainder of her examination findings are unremarkable. Of the following, this adolescent’s MOST likely diagnosis is

A 10-year-old boy is brought to the clinic for a health supervision visit. He has chronic kidney disease and will receive a kidney transplant in the future. His mother inquires about what to expect regarding his linear growth, which has been closely monitored. He is at the first percentile for height for his age and is sexual maturity rating stage 1. Of the following, the BEST response to his mother is

options.label: A
options.text: He is likely to have significant catch-up growth and normal adult height

options.label: B
options.text: He would likely benefit from growth hormone to increase his final adult height

options.label: C
options.text: Immunosuppression with steroids is likely to increase his final adult height

options.label: D
options.text: Transplant is unlikely to affect growth or final adult height

questions.correct_answer: B. He would likely benefit from growth hormone to increase his final adult height
